name: Landers Falls
description:
Introduction

This canyon is described in comprehensive detail in Canyoning Around Victoria guidebook

Approach

The approach is short. Follow the track for the Landers Falls Lookout and take a turn off the track towards the creek. Map detailed in the guidebook. Enter the creek via some scrambling and bush bashing depending on where you enter.

Descent

The crux is from P4 down to the bottom of P5. Bolts from P5 are at a very small ledge (2 person only) that is ~10cm wide in sections and close to the flow. It is almost a hanging belay. Be cautious not to miss the P5 bolts as you come down the P4 abseil. Re-rig from here to descend to the pool via the small beautiful slot that is the last 15m of P5. Look up and view the amphitheatre of rock and spray! Most of the flow can be avoided until the last ~5m of P5 by following the large mossy slab to the TL of the slot.

The view of previous 2 abseils from the pool at the bottom of P5 is amazing.

Use a meat anchor for safety to reach the bolts for P6.

Exit

The exit is quite steep in sections with some exposure. Allow plenty of time for this, especially if your party is not confident with steep bush bashing and bouldering with some exposure. Be prepared for plenty of bush bashing as the bush continues to recover from the 2019-2020 fires. The map provided in the Canyoning In Victoria Guidebook provides a yellow exit line that aligns well with downloadable topo maps that you can reference your GPS position on.

There are climbing moves required at the steep end section up to around Ewbank grade 12. These can be assisted by throwing a handline at the start of the day from P1 directly opposite the bolts. Around 30-40m should cover most of the more difficult end section.

Red tape

The access road to Landers Falls 4WD carpark point is often closed during winter - check NPWS website.
